column11: Wireless sensor network (WSN) is one of popular research issues, and ZigBee is an important protocol for WSN. Traditionally, the device addresses in WSN are given by a Distributed Address Allocation Mechanism (DAAM). Although DAAM has better extensibility, this network topology resulted by DAAM did not consider fast routing between nodes. Although binary tree topology benefits a faster packet routing via a simple Boolean computation, the binary tree is less extensible. In this paper, a new variation of binary tree topology is proposed to assign nodes under routers the addresses for fast routing. The proposed approach improves the low utility rate of the network address for DAAM.

column11: Online social networks and peer-to-peer (P2P) data swarming are a natural match, but a significant distinction between a traditional P2P swarming system and its social version is the social ties among peers which suppress the free riding behavior and make cooperation among peers feasible. In this paper, we present a game theoretical formulation for cooperative data distribution based on friend coalitions in a social P2P swarming system and derive a Nash bargaining solution for a two-player bargaining game with the analysis of Pareto optimality and fairness. But the relative weak computing power of the phone and the complex uncertain environment become the A chilles' heel for middleware systems on the mobile devices. This paper presents a Context-Aware Reasoning Middleware (CARM) which provides a solution by adopting the Bayesian network for uncertain inference and designing a mechanism to give the middleware an access to powerful computation ability. We implement the middleware system and shown that the CARM lets applications on the phone to gain the ability of becoming more context-aware.

column11: The key to granular computing (GrC) is to make use of granules in problem solving. With the view point of GrC, the notion of a granule may be interpreted as one of the numerous small particles forming a larger unit. In many situations, there are different granules at different levels of scale in data sets having hierarchical scale structures. The multi-scale information system is a new and interesting topic in the theory of GrC. In this paper, the multi-granulation rough set approach is introduced into the multi-scale information systems. Firstly, the notion of multi-scale information systems is introduced. In multi-scale information systems, a hierarchical structure of granules can be obtained. At every level, the optimistic and the pessimistic multi-granulation rough sets can be defined based on a family of the equivalence relations. Analogously, the boundary region can be defined as usual at every level. Furthermore, the properties of the lower approximations, the upper approximations, the boundary region, the approximation accuracy, and the roughness between different levels are discussed respectively.
